revised_title: The Histology of Cell Wall and Connecting Threads in Pinus sylvestris
tldr: The authors investigate the histology of the cell wall and the role of connecting threads in the tissues of Pinus sylvestris. They describe the structure and function of the endosperm, cotyledons, hypocotyl, and root in germinating seeds and young plants. The study reveals the importance of connecting threads in the transport of nutrients and ferments between cells and tissues in the plant.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
